messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unsubscribing
messages.msgSnippet: ... Good luck! I certainly understand about the time thing. And at some point it s best to stop reading about it and just do it. But we ll still be here if you
messages.messageBody:
on 1/31/03 7:22 PM, HappyMato2@... at HappyMato2@... wrote:

> It has been great talking to everyone and receiving a lot of information. I
> feel I have to say goodbye for a while so that I can spend more time with my
> children. Lately, I think I've been spending too much time on the computer.
> I get so many emails from this list and all of them are so interesting that I
> can't seem to get away. When I look at the time, I can't believe how long
> I've spent on the computer. My children really need my undivided attention,
> even when they are watching tv and I'm not really into it. I want to be with
> them.

Good luck! I certainly understand about the time thing. And at some point
it's best to stop reading about it and just do it.

But we'll still be here if you need us :-)

Joyce

messages.subject: Unsubscribing
messages.msgSnippet: It has been great talking to everyone and receiving a lot of information.  I feel I have to say goodbye for a while so that I can spend more time with my
messages.messageBody:
It has been great talking to everyone and receiving a lot of information. I
feel I have to say goodbye for a while so that I can spend more time with my
children. Lately, I think I've been spending too much time on the computer.
I get so many emails from this list and all of them are so interesting that I
can't seem to get away. When I look at the time, I can't believe how long
I've spent on the computer. My children really need my undivided attention,
even when they are watching tv and I'm not really into it. I want to be with
them.

Thank you for all your help!!

Patti


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
You have to put the unsubscribe in the mailing address for it to work. I
believe it is unschooling-dotcom-unsubscribe@egroups.com?? or maybe
unsubscribe goes first??

Good luck, sorry to see you go.

Bonnie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] (no subject)
messages.msgSnippet: JodyeB1@aol.com wrote:. Success stories would ... They re coming, they re coming!  I finished writing *Homeschoolers Success Stories* on time and it s
messages.messageBody:
JodyeB1@... wrote:.

Success stories would

> be great, especially stories of older kids. Thanks.
>
> Jodye

They're coming, they're coming! I finished writing *Homeschoolers'
Success Stories* on time and it's scheduled for June release. 15 "grown" hsers,
12 youngsters, mostly teens. Some of them were unschoolers, others more
traditional, all loving the work they've chosen. They're quite a bunch I'm glad
to have gotten the chance to meet.

Best,
Linda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] (no subject)
messages.msgSnippet: Just a suggestion to the list owner. Perhaps at the bottom of every message you could put the instructions for unsubscribing? I ve noticed on Onelist that many
messages.messageBody:
Just a suggestion to the list owner. Perhaps at the bottom of every
message you could put the instructions for unsubscribing? I've noticed
on Onelist that many (many, many) people forget how they subscribed and
try to unsubscribe as this person did. Onelist has an option for a
tagline. In the tagline you could put the simple instructions of how to
unsubscribe.

For "The Prisoner" - go to onelist.com. Then go to your lists. Then
check unsubscribe for this list.

Shannon, Mom to Bridget (Oct.8.98)


twilitMS@... wrote:
> unsubscribe
> "I resigned. I will not be pushed, filed, indexed, briefed,
> debriefed or numbered. My life is my own."
>
> The Prisoner
